column4: HAN SOLO in CARBONITE is probably the best Brickheadz model to date. More detailed than previous Brickheadz

column2: pick one of these up you had to attend NYCC 2017 and enter&nbsp
column3: a preshow lottery via New York Comic Con&#39
column4: s website. Winners of the raffle can purchase the limited-edition set from the Lego Mobile BrickHeadZ Truck at Comic Con. From what I understand they had more in stock, so if you didn&#39

column1: Premium packaging here. Sturdy slipcase with excellent graphics all around (even on the numbered tape seal). I got number 1112 (which I believe is out of 5000).
Back (with New York Comic Con Exclusive graphic)...
After carefully cutting the seal, we separate the sturdy slipcase. We get 2 well printed instruction booklets and 2 bags. The bags are not numbered (even though in the instructions they'
column6: ) but you can see which bag belongs to its respective builds. The bags are resealable, which I wish Lego would do more to breakdown and repackage kits.

column1: The booklets are so well printed, excellent paper quality and have sharp,
column2: clear step by step instructions. Also, no stickers in this kit, with a plethora of printed/decorated elements.

column2: m not a BrickHeadZ compleatist but this by far is the best of the line. The details, the packaging, the prints, all stellar!
these were selling for over $200usd presale. If you were lucky to attend, only $40 bucks-so quite reasonable. Now online I see, as of this review, about $100 to $150usd or so. If you&#39
column4: pull the trigger and get a Brickheadz, this is the one! Check eBay and look for a deal.
